tables.questionText: Of the alcoholic drinks you had in the past week, how many were consumed at each of the following locations? (Enter a whole number for each location.)

rows.label: At a casual dining restaurant (e.g., Applebee's, Chili's)
At an upscale casual dining restaurant (e.g., Hillstone, Seasons 52, North Italia)
At a fine dining restaurant (e.g., Mastro's, Capital Grille, Nick & Sam's)
At a local sports bar or pub (e.g., Irish pub, Dave & Buster's)
At a premium bar or upscale lounge
At a recreation or entertainment venue (e.g., country club, casino, private club)
At a concession stand or festival (e.g., stadium, live music event, food festival)
At an airport or other transit location
At a college/university dorm or apartment
At an outdoor gathering (e.g., BBQ, picnic, tailgate)

tables.baseText: Respondents who consumed at least one alcoholic drink in the past week
tables.userNote: (Enter whole numbers for each location; responses across locations sum to total drinks in the past week)

tables.questionText: Did you consume any of the following products/substances at the same time as the drink you were describing?

tables.questionText: Who was with you when you had this drink?
tables.userNote: (Select all that apply; “I was alone” was an anchor and mutually exclusive with other options)

tables.questionText: What other drinks did you have in addition to the drink you selected? (Select all that apply)
tables.baseText: Respondents who had one or more additional drinks at the same location (A13a = "Yes")

tables.questionText: Which of the following best describes why you decided to purchase [INSERT A4]?

rows.label: I needed to stock up on / refill my alcohol supply
While shopping for groceries, I decided to pick up alcohol
I wanted to browse the place’s alcohol selection and ended up purchasing
I wanted to add a new bottle to my at-home bar
I needed it for a specific gathering, party, or event
I saw it on social media and wanted to try
Someone told me I needed to try it
I bought it to make a specific cocktail
I thought my visiting family/friends would enjoy it

tables.baseText: Asked of respondents who purchased the drink (those who selected that they purchased the drink)

tables.questionText: Which of the following best describes why you purchased from the store? (Select all that apply.)

rows.label: It’s convenient / close to home or work
It offers the best prices or promotions
It has the best selection / variety
It’s where I do my regular shopping (groceries, errands, etc.)
It was the only store open / available at the time
It’s my go‑to place to purchase alcohol
It was my only option due to state or local laws
It was the only place I could buy this type of drink

tables.baseText: Respondents who purchased the drink (asked of those who purchased the drink)

tables.questionText: When you purchased the drink, which of the following describes why you chose that brand? (Select all that apply)

rows.label: It's the brand I always get
It was the best price for the quality I wanted
I liked the packaging (e.g., design, colors)
The store had it on display (e.g., end cap or table)
It had a special promotion / discount
It was the first one I saw
I liked the product description on the packaging
The store had a note describing the flavor / ways to drink it
It was recommended to me by a store associate

tables.questionText: Which best describes the reason for having a drink in the past week?

rows.label: A way to feel closer to others and strengthen bonds
A way to demonstrate that you have good taste
A chance to try something new
A way to celebrate or mark a moment / achievement
An escape from stress or routine
A way to keep the night going

tables.baseText: Asked about the drink at the selected location

tables.questionText: You said your reason for having a drink in the past week was best described as [pipe: S10a lower]. More specifically, what best describes that moment?

rows.label: A drink to bring everyone together at the start of the night
Something to sip while catching up with friends
A drink that feels appropriate for the situation at a social gathering
A go-to choice for reconnecting with someone after time apart
A drink that makes me feel confident and put-together in social settings
Something that looks elevated or premium when served
A drink that feels on-trend or buzzworthy
A drink I'd be proud to post or share on social media
A drink I've never tried before that sparks curiosity
A limited-edition or seasonal release I want to experience before it's gone
A drink that transports me somewhere new—culturally or emotionally
A drink to toast a personal win or milestone
Something festive to share when good news hits
A way to make an ordinary day or night feel a little more special
A drink I reach for when I just want what I want
A drink that feels like I'm treating myself
A drink to help me unwind after a long or stressful day
Something I reach for when I need a mental reset
A drink that helps me slow down and be present
A go-to when I want to escape the usual and feel transported
A drink that helps me feel confident and socially on-point for a night out
Something I choose when I want to bring my A-game to socialize
A go-to when I want to stay in control and keep the night flowing smoothly
A drink that's always part of our holiday or seasonal celebrations
Something I serve because it's what we've always had at family gatherings
A drink that helps keep a cultural or regional tradition alive
Something I choose because it reminds me of home or loved ones

changes: s1: labels - cleaned and shortened labels to match survey answer text; clarified 'None of the above' as exclusive.
s1: nets - added a multi-variable NET ('Any listed industry (NET)') combining S1r1-S1r7 to show respondents who selected any listed industry.
s1: userNote - added '(Select all that apply)'.
s1: surveySection - set to SCREENER.
s1: structure - placed NET above its component rows (components indented) and kept 'None of the above' as a top-level exclusive row.
s6a: labels - Replaced generic labels with answer text from survey (e.g., 'Mexico', 'Puerto Rico', etc.).
s6a: nets - Added multi-variable NET '_NET_S6a_Any' (Any country/region listed) with components S6ar1..S6ar8.

s6a: questionText/baseText/userNote - Updated questionText to verbatim survey wording; noted that this question was asked only of respondents who are of Hispanic/Latino origin and added '(Select all that apply)'.
s6a: isDerived - Marked table as derived because a synthetic NET row was added.
s7: labels - cleaned row labels to match survey answer text and updated question text to full verbatim prompt.
s7: nets - added multi-variable NET '_NET_AnyRace' aggregating S7r1..S7r6 (isNet with netComponents).
s7: userNote - added '(Select all that apply)' to clarify response format.
s7: isDerived - set true because a synthetic NET row was created; original variables preserved as components (indented).
s9: labels - Rewrote long datamap labels to concise, reader-friendly location labels pulled from survey text.

s9: nets - Added two mean_rows NETs: _NET_OnPremise (components: S9r5,S9r6,S9r7,S9r8,S9r9,S9r10,S9r11,S9r12,S9r13,S9r14,S9r16) and _NET_OffPremise (components: S9r1,S9r2,S9r3,S9r4,S9r15) to provide on-/off-premise comparisons. (mean_rows NETs use netComponents and filterValue is left blank per rules.)
s9: userNote/baseText - Added baseText clarifying who was asked and a userNote about input format and that location values sum to S8.
a7_1: labels - Shortened and cleaned long autogenerated labels to match survey phrasing.
a7_1: nets - Added synthetic NET row '_NET_AnySubstances' (isNet) combining A7r1..A7r5 to show 'Any substance (NET)'.
a7_1: structure - Indented individual substance rows under the NET for readability. Kept 'None of the above' as a standalone top-level row.
a7_1: metadata - Populated surveySection as 'OCCASION LOOP', added baseText and userNote to clarify context and response instructions.
a9_1: labels - Simplified and corrected row labels to match survey text; added category header for visual grouping.
a9_1: nets - Added multi-variable NET '_NET_A9_Others' combining A9r2..A9r7 to show 'Any other person (NET)'.
a9_1: split/no_change - Kept original rows and supplemented with NET; marked rows that roll up as indented components.
a13b_1: labels - Shortened and cleaned labels to match survey text (removed pipe tokens).
a13b_1: nets - Added multi-variable NET '_NET_A13b_AnyOther' combining A13br1..A13br5 to show percent who had any additional drink.
a13b_1: isDerived - Marked table as derived because a synthetic NET variable was added.
a13b_1: userNote/baseText - Added (Select all that apply) user note and baseText clarifying this was asked only of respondents who reported additional drinks (A13a=1).
a16_1: labels - Simplified and normalized component labels to match survey text (removed extraneous pipe placeholders).
a16_1: nets - Added multi-variable NET '_NET_A16_Any' aggregating A16r1..A16r10 (Any purchase reason).
a16_1: userNote - Added '(Select all that apply)' since this is a multi-select question.
a16_1: surveySection/baseText - Set survey section to OCCASION LOOP and noted this is asked of respondents who purchased the drink.
a17_1: labels - Shortened and cleaned long piped labels to match survey wording; removed pipe tokens and redundant text.
a17_1: nets - Added multi-variable NET row (_NET_A17_AnyReason) that sums A17r1..A17r9 (isNet=true and netComponents populated).
a17_1: questionText - Replaced generic questionText with the survey verbatim (cleaned) and added (Select all that apply) as user guidance.
a17_1: metadata - Assigned surveySection = OCCASION LOOP, baseText set to indicate this was asked of purchasers, marked table as derived because a synthetic NET row was added.
a19_1: labels - Cleaned long datamap-suffixed labels to match survey text and removed redundant trailing pipe text.
a19_1: nets - Added multi-variable NET '_NET_A19_AnyReason' to capture respondents selecting any reason (rolls up A19r1..A19r11). 'None of the above' kept separate at top-level.
a19_1: userNote/surveySection - Populated surveySection, baseText and userNote for context. Marked table as derived because NET was added.
a21: labels - Replaced generic row labels with verbatim answer text from the survey (e.g., 'Tito's Handmade Vodka', 'Grey Goose', etc.).
a21: nets - Added multi-variable NET '_NET_AnyBrand' (Any brand) aggregating A21r1..A21r6 to show overall awareness. Components indented under the NET. Kept 'None of the above' as a standalone row.
a21: userNote - Added '(Select all that apply)' to clarify response format.
a21: surveySection - Mapped question to 'OCCASION LOOP' (question lives outside the loops but before Section B).
a22_tito_s_column_: labels - Cleaned long system labels to the attribute names from the survey (e.g., 'Premium', 'Approachable', etc.).

a22_tito_s_column_: metadata - Added questionText from survey (cleaned), surveySection set to OCCASION LOOP, baseText noting this is asked of respondents who selected brands in A21, userNote added to clarify select-all/binary flag, tableSubtitle set to 'Tito’s Handmade Vodka'.

a22_tito_s_column_: structure - Kept one frequency table for the Tito's column (split was intentional upstream). No NETs or T2B created because items are binary flags (select-all) and NETs would be trivial or not meaningful.

a22_grey_goose_column_: labels — Replaced autogenerated row labels with clean attribute text (e.g., 'A22r1c2: ...' → 'Premium'). Added context fields: surveySection, baseText, userNote, and tableSubtitle='Grey Goose'. No NETs or T2B applied because these are binary flag (select-all) items.
a22_ketel_one_column_: labels - Updated long datamap labels to concise attribute labels matching survey (e.g., 'A22r1c3: Ketel One - Premium...' -> 'Premium').
a22_ketel_one_column_: context - Added surveySection, baseText, userNote and tableSubtitle to clarify this is the Ketel One column (A22 asked only for brands selected in A21).
a22_ketel_one_column_: nets/t2b - No NETs or T2B created (binary multi-select; NETs not meaningful here).
a22_maker_s_mark_column_: labels - replaced verbose datamap labels with attribute short labels (Premium, Approachable, etc.); preserved variables and filterValue=1.
a22_maker_s_mark_column_: metadata - set questionText to survey wording, added tableSubtitle 'Maker's Mark', surveySection 'OCCASION LOOP', baseText and userNote to clarify who saw the item.
a22_casamigos_column_: labels — Replaced generic datamap labels with clean attribute names from the survey (Premium, Approachable, Authentic, etc.).
a22_casamigos_column_: context — Added surveySection (OCCASION LOOP), baseText (respondents who selected one or more brands in A21), and userNote '(Select all that apply)'.
a22_casamigos_column_: no NETs/T2B — Binary flag variables (0/1) for brand-attribute associations; NETs or box-score rollups are not appropriate.
a22_don_julio_column_: labels - Replaced generic row labels with clean attribute names from the survey (e.g., 'Premium', 'Approachable', etc.).
a22_don_julio_column_: header - Added a category header row to factor the common question prefix and improve scanability.
a22_don_julio_column_: metadata - Populated surveySection, baseText, userNote and tableSubtitle to provide context (asked only of respondents who selected any brand in A21; select-all question).

a22_tito_s_column_c1_: labels — Simplified row labels to attribute names (e.g., 'Premium' instead of the long auto-generated label); questionText updated to verbatim survey wording; added baseText and userNote to indicate this is a select-all asked only of respondents who selected brands in A21. No NETs or box-score added because these are binary select-all flags. Table treated as a split from parent table 'a22'.

a22_grey_goose_column_c2_: labels updated to attribute text, added a header row 'Grey Goose' and indented attribute rows for readability; clarified questionText and metadata (surveySection, baseText, userNote, tableSubtitle).
a22_ketel_one_column_c3_: labels - simplified verbose datamap labels to the attribute names (e.g., 'Premium'), removed question id prefix from questionText.

c3: labels - Replaced technical datamap labels with verbatim answer text from the survey for each C3 binary flag (e.g., 'C3r2: Employed full-time' -> 'Employed full-time').

c3: nets - Added two meaningful multi-variable NETs: _NET_Employed (Employed full-time, Employed part-time, Self-employed) and _NET_OutOfWork (Out of work 1+ year, Out of work <1 year). These help analysts see employment vs. unemployment at a glance while keeping components available.

s3: questionText cleaned (removed question number prefix). Labels verified against survey and left as-is. Marked as frequency, single-select. No NETs or splits needed; included user note '(Single select)'.
No exclusion applied — although option 4 ('Prefer not to answer') is a termination path in survey programming, the response category is retained for reporting.
s5: labels - Expanded truncated datamap labels to full survey wording (e.g., 'Less than $30,000', '$30,000 - $49,999', etc.).

s5: nets - Added three conceptual NET rows for analytical convenience: Lower income (Under $50,000) = options 1,2; Middle income ($50,000 - $99,999) = options 3,4; Higher income ($100,000 or greater) = options 5-9. Each NET has the component rows indented beneath it.
s5: readability - Organized rows into three grouped NETs + 'Prefer not to answer' to keep the table scannable and interpretable for analysts.
s6: questionText cleaned (removed prefix), labels verified against survey; no NETs or rollups created because this is a simple demographic binary; added user note '(Select one)'.

s8_binned: userNote - Added note that respondents reporting 0 were terminated and that bins are for readability.
